snippet: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki said defeating extremist Sunni groups was more urgent than bridging Iraq’s political divides, contrary to the urging of the United States and others.
abstract: Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki says that finding a political settlement to the differences among the country’s factions is not as important or urgent as fighting extremist Sunni insurgents; at same time he offers amnesty to anyone who fought with or supported the insurgents; International supporters of Iraq have criticized Maliki for failing to form an inclusive government.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and Suadad al-Salhy from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki said defeating extremist Sunni groups was more urgent than bridging Iraq’s political divides, contrary to the urging of the United States and others.

headline.main: Iraqi Premier Places Unity Second to Fighting ISIS
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Premier Places Unity Second to Fighting ISIS

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
